column1: Coronary angiography is a procedure that uses a special dye (contrast material) and x-rays to see how blood flows through the arteries in your heart.
- You are going to have surgery on your heart and you are at high risk for coronary artery disease.
- The contrast dye could damage the kidneys (particularly in people with diabetes or prior kidney problems).
If a blockage is found, your health care provider may perform a percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI) to open the blockage.
